snippet: When we sit down every four years to cheer the world’s best athletes, are we identifying with their achievements or their misery?
abstract: Heather Havrilesky Riff essay speculates whether watching Olympic athletes is partly enjoyable because of the amount of misery they endure in order to be great.
lead_paragraph: When we sit down every four years to cheer the world’s best athletes, are we identifying with their achievements or their misery?

headline.seo: The Loneliness of Watching the Long-Distance Runner
headline.main: The Loneliness of the Person Watching the Long-Distance Runner
headline.print_headline: The Loneliness of the Person Watching the Long-Distance Runner
